citeinfo.origin: National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC)
citeinfo.title: Arctic Ice Dynamics Joint Experiment - Ice Profile Sonar

descript.abstract: On 7-10 April 1976, the submarine USS Gurnard participated in the Arctic Ice Dynamics Joint Experiment (AIDJEX) by traversing 777 nautical miles along 3 tracklines in the Beaufort Sea. The resulting data set of ice thickness data originated from upward-looking acoustical soundings (sonar). Data are ice profiles, including latitude/longitude, ping interval, surface beam diameter, number of data points and ice thickness.
descript.purpose: Create a data set to include ice thickness data originated from upward-looking acoustical soundings (sonar). Data are ice profiles, including latitude/longitude, upping interval, surface beam diameter, number of data points and ice thickness in the Beaufort Sea.

idinfo.accconst: Copies of the tape can be obtained for the cost of reproduction. There are no restrictions on the distribution of these data.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
